extends Object

Method Summary
static boolean checkNewProjectName(String projectName)
          Determines whether the given project name is valid, displaying an alert if it is not.
static boolean isValidCharFilename(String filename)
          Checks whether the argument is a legal filename, meaning it is unchanged by URL encoding and it meets the aapt requirements as follows: - all characters must be 7-bit printable ASCII - none of { '/' '\\' ':' }
static boolean isValidIdentifier(String text)
          Checks whether the argument is a legal identifier, specifically, a non-empty string starting with a letter and followed by any number of (unaccented English) letters, digits, or underscores.
static boolean isValidLengthFilename(String filename)
          Checks whether the argument is a filename which meets the length requirement imposed by aapt, which is: - the filename length must be less than kMaxAssetFileName bytes long (and can't be empty) where kMaxAssetFileName is defined to be 100.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

checkNewProjectName

public static boolean checkNewProjectName(String projectName)
Determines whether the given project name is valid, displaying an alert if it is not. In order to be valid, the project name must satisfy isValidIdentifier(String) and not be a duplicate of an existing project name for the same user.

Parameters:
projectName - the project name to validate
Returns:
true if the project name is valid, false otherwise

isValidIdentifier

public static boolean isValidIdentifier(String text)
Checks whether the argument is a legal identifier, specifically, a non-empty string starting with a letter and followed by any number of (unaccented English) letters, digits, or underscores.

Parameters:
text - the proposed identifier
Returns:
true if the argument is a legal identifier, false otherwise

isValidCharFilename

public static boolean isValidCharFilename(String filename)
Checks whether the argument is a legal filename, meaning it is unchanged by URL encoding and it meets the aapt requirements as follows: - all characters must be 7-bit printable ASCII - none of { '/' '\\' ':' }

Parameters:
filename - The filename (not path) of uploaded file
Returns:
true if the argument is a legal filename, false otherwise

isValidLengthFilename

public static boolean isValidLengthFilename(String filename)
Checks whether the argument is a filename which meets the length requirement imposed by aapt, which is: - the filename length must be less than kMaxAssetFileName bytes long (and can't be empty) where kMaxAssetFileName is defined to be 100. (A legal name, therefore, has length <= kMaxAssetFileNames)

Parameters:
filename - The filename (not path) of uploaded file
Returns:
true if the length of the argument is legal, false otherwise
